Review Title: You get what you pay for
Negative Reviews: It's a massive place so it's not really the kind of hostel where it is easy to meet new people. There are similarly not many places for you to sit to socialise with other people. As it is such a big place and there are so many people staying there at once, they don't seem to be able to check who is coming in and out. As a result, there was an issue in my room as the guy staying in the bed above me brought 2 girls back to the room at night. A member of staff only came up to deal with this incident after another girl in the room complained the following morning. Luckily, nothing happened but it does bring up questions about safety.
Positive Reviews: Great location as it is on Gran via and is close to loads of nice food places. There is a curtain on the bed which adds a bit more privacy. The room and communal bathrooms were very clean. The bed was pretty comfortable and overall it was good value for money.
Room Type: Single Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room

Negative Reviews: Whilst they tried to keep on top of the cleaning some people managed to make it look like a tornado had run through the toilets and showers in no time, so could do with some checkups during the day but see why that would be hard to keep on top of. Might have been because there was a festival on when I was there so big festival crowd. Also some things were run down and needed fixing, nothing big more like a lose sink knob, bed curtain rail falling down, that type of thing. The showers were probably the worst thing, they were hard to get to a consistent heat and the pressure depended on each shower, but otherwise all good, and that were just minor annoyances.
Positive Reviews: The location was great. Near a bus to the airport, near the metro, almost in the middle of the centre, plenty of food places and shops etc. The staff were friendly and helpful. Positive Reviews:
Location 10/10 - Located in the middle of Calle Gran Via, that is one of the best locations to stay in Madrid. You have a close access to metro station Gran Via, train station Sol, and bus station Sevilla/Sol. Also the place is located quite close to famous tourist attractions like Puerta del Sol, Plaza de Espa√±a and Plaza Mayor.
Staff 10/10 - They were so kind from the first moment to the last. They helped me with storing my luggage and whenever I had any problem they offered help with all their kindness. They also advised me a very delicious pizza store called Pizza Vesuvio- 10/10 recommendation.
Breakfast 7/10 - 6 euro per day, you are free to choose what you are gonna have. It‚Äôs just not my type of breakfast that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs 7/10. But you may like it - and also the lady working there was so kind. 
Price 10/10 - I found this place at minute and got the benefit of last minute deal. It was incredible to stay in a place like this in a city like Madrid just for ‚Ç¨13/night. Nowhere you can find a better place with the same conditions. 
Facilities 10/10 - The toilets/bathrooms were clean and the price was towel included which is something you cannot find in many places. They gave us the locker for only deposit which is also something other places may charge you for. 

In total, it was a very good experience from the beginning to the end and it is highly recommended. The best place to stay when you visit Madrid - 10/10!

Review Title: I want to come to this hostel again, so pleasant!
Negative Reviews:
The bathrooms and showers are outside, so it was a bit hassle to always open the dormitory door with the key. Also the seaming of the tiles in the showers were done negligently, what made me to wonder, what kind of cheap and unprofessional labour they had to do it. Also no hooks inside the showers! Where to put the towel and the possible bag with clothes and the detergents etc? The hooks were outside, but I want my door key and other stuff to be inside the shower cabinet!! That should be fixed right away.

I couldnt take a breakfast due to early flight back home, but I went to see the room, and you can use it as a social room during the evenings, what was good, but there was quite stale air! So that was a minus, it didnt attract me to go to sit there at all. I dont get it, dont they have an AC there at all, as it works very well everywhere else!
Positive Reviews:
This hostel made me to come again! The very friendly receptionist made me to feel welcome, and he also offered me the cold water bottle free! They also changed the room smoothly, when in the first room was a party of some young boys going on! :D 

In my new mix room were nice people from South America, and with one person from Venezuela I had such an interesting chat. The bed itself was good with lovely blanket and air condition and curtains. Although the hostel is situated along a busy street, the noise was not heard at all. I can warmly recommend this hostel! :)

Negative Reviews: There weren¬¥t many places to hang out, or to chill in the hostel.
Positive Reviews: It was  a nice place, great location and the room was great.
Room Type: Single Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room

Negative Reviews: The showers because it was a bit tricky to find where the water was warm.
Positive Reviews:
I stayed for two nights in a mixed dorm bedroom. 
The bed was very comfortable, people respectful and the breakfast (you pay extra for it if you want it) was exceptional. It's a great place to come if you're a digital nomad and you need a quiet place to work. My impression is that this is not a hostel to meet fellow solo travelers, everyone were minding their own business.

Negative Reviews: Nothing:)
Positive Reviews: Location was perfect. Hostel was so clean and well-designed. The room and luggage cupboard was big enough. I could fit my big size suitcase and also my backpack. Beds were really comfortable clean. It's nice that they gave us clean towels. The staff were very kind. They let me leave my luggage after I checked-out. The price was also good for the facilites I got.
The staff is friendly, professional and helpful. There was a noise coming from one of the rooms at night. The staff quickly solved the problem. I'd definitely recommend the hostel.

confort and localitation 
frendly staff

Review Title: I would definitely recommend this place just for how it‚Äôs located right on Gran V√≠a  and it‚Äôs actually one of the better
Negative Reviews: The bathroom sinks were dirty all the time. A quick wipe down once a day would have been nice. The biggest shower room had only one soap dispenser filled for the time I stayed there which was incredibly annoying. I stayed for 5 days and the worst thing was that the one toilet  in the lobby didn‚Äôt have any soap. For almost a week no one thought of refilling the soap dispenser; that shocked me! I also found pther people‚Äòs hair in my bed and my locker. I saw how the beds are cleaned after a guest leaves: they are not really being cleaned; it‚Äôs just new sheets and a towel and  quick wipe down.
Positive Reviews: Curtains for privacy and many shower rooms and toilet stalls so you never had to wait in line to wash up! I also liked that they gave you a towel and a lock for your locker under the bed (huge btw so plenty of space to even store your suitase) which is not as common as you would like. The staff was very friendly!

My drawer under the bed did not close propely and I had to try and adjust it a lot, so it made a lot of noise.
Key card to enter the room stopped worked three times during my stay, receptionists fixed it, so all good. Just a bit inconvienent.
Also, all the water faucets and shower system only allows for water to run for a minute or so before you have to turn it on again. I get it's to save water, it's okay to install this for the sinks, but for shower it's very bothersome to use.

Review Title: Overall I believe this is worth the value. Location is awesome, I felt safe and beds are comfortable
Negative Reviews: Breakfast is not good, food is not tasty. I would recommend you to go outside for breakfast, you could also find cheap options everywhere in Madrid and even close to the hostel. This is not a party hostel, people get there only to sleep and there's no lounge where hosts gather, so be aware of that. I liked the quietness, but it all depends on what you're looking for. Also not all bathrooms were functional, good things is that there are several across the halls so you will find an empty one for sure. You need to be lucky with the hot water though, could be that it is super hot or mild warm and there's no option to control it.
Positive Reviews: Location was amazing, just in the middle of Gran Via! The rooms were spacious and beds didn't make any noise while moving. Every bed had it's own curtain, light bulb and energy switch. Also the space to leave the luggage under the bed was spacious enough for a carry-on size plus a backpack and something small extra. The room had it's own small balcony which allowed us to have some fresh air during the day, black-out curtains were awesome specially for those sunny days in Madrid. Bed was very comfortable, clean and duvet was warm.

Review Title: I can really recommend this hostel, I liked it.
Negative Reviews: The bunk beds were new and okay, but the handles or handrails on the upper bed could be a lot higher. The problem is that the mattress is so thick, which is great and comfy to sleep on, but does not go well with the rails. They just don't fit. The whole time I was scared to fall off the bed - and I did. I tried to grab the upper rails and handles, while climbing down the bed, but I missed one after taking a shower and also because I was tired, and I slipped and fell hard onto the concrete floor, landed right on my back. I was lucky. My feet felt tingly and I just had a concussion on my back, but I did get injured. I still cannot move at all without feeling the pain. Still, it could have been a lot worse after having such an accident... The second night I slept in the lower bunk. I was relieved and felt much more at ease.

Review Title: Few areas that could benefit from improvement
Negative Reviews:
One aspect that stood out was the need for more attention to the cleanliness and maintenance of the toilets and bathrooms. I noticed that some of the shower cabins were not functioning properly,  which was a bit inconvenient. It would be great if the hostel could ensure that all facilities are in good working order and regularly maintained to provide a more comfortable experience for guests.

Another point to note was that the rooms tended to get quite warm during my stay. It would be helpful if the hostel could address this issue by improving the ventilation or providing fans or air conditioning units to enhance the comfort of guests, especially during warmer months.

These improvements would greatly enhance the comfort and satisfaction of guests staying at the hostel.
Positive Reviews:
I recently had the opportunity to stay at Gran V√≠a Hostel in Madrid, and while my overall experience was good, there were a few areas that could benefit from improvement.

On a positive note, the breakfast provided at Gran V√≠a Hostel was good, offering a variety of options to start the day. The staff members were also friendly and welcoming, which added to the overall positive experience.

Location was also very communicative and central!

Review Title: Excellent location, modern and clean, I would recommend to everyone.

Positive Reviews:
The hostel is on the Gran Via, which basically one of the main streets in the city. Easy to approach the shopping malls, restaurants, historically important buildings. There are grocery stores in the nearby.
The room was large, clean, they had the pillows and blankets were ready when I arrived. There is a light and two charger plots for every bed. Beds are wide and tall, so it is extremely comfortable to sleep in. There is a curtain on the bed which blocks pretty much all the light from the roommates/windows I could sleep peacefully. The balcony and the sight from the balcony was just perfect.
There was an AC on, it was quiet and was working well.
The corridors, the bathrooms were perfectly OK, clean and equipped.

Review Title: Excellent location in the heart center of Madrid, easy to reach by bus from the airport
Positive Reviews:
Location is excellent, right in the center center of MADRID. And easy to reach by Bus from the airport. The bus costs 5$ and you go off at the second stop called CIBELLES, walk 450m and reach the hotel on the right side. it takes about 45 min from the airport (including the walk) Bus drives every 20 minutes. 
The hotel is outside one of these stunning old buildings but inside super modern, keeping the vast architecture of the past. Rooms are super clean, very comfortable beds, clean bathrooms with shampoo, soap,and hairdryer, AC everywhere, Madrid can get very sticky hot in summer months. The Stuff is friendly and helpful. There is a large co-working space in the first floor, where you can work with fast wifi or make coffee and tea or have your own breakfast. The hotel doesnt offer meals but just across is a very healthy delicious restaurant called HONEST GREEN with smoothies cold pressed, salads, sandwiches, coffee, vegan and vegetarian friendly but also offer meat and fish. I had the tuna tatami with salad and it was just delicious. 
For dinner or snacks you just walk through the Gran Via and there are plenty of TAPAS BARS which serve all day and late at night a variety of tasty snacks. Tortilla espanola, croquettas, pulpo, boquerones etc.
Room Type: Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room

Review Title: Amazing but super noisy at nights
Negative Reviews: It was impossible to sleep because of the noise! First of all the rooms are very warm . This forces us to keep the window open for air. Naturally, this will bring all the noise from outside in. However this was not as much of a problem as the noise in the corridors. At 2 am until 4 am, both nights I  was staying in, people were blasting music in the bathrooms and the corridors, laughing, dancing, screaming...you name it. It was like a huge party was happening. Of course there was no party but just extremely noisy guests. Bluesock hostels are amazing in every location I have been, but I urge this one to please take care of how respectful their guests are during the night hours. Unfortunately not everyone is in Madrid to party and should be able to have some decent sleep at night.

The person sleeping in the upper bed left while I was asleep and then a personnel came to the room to put a new pillow, blanket, towel, etc inside the drawers beneath the bed -my bed actually- and it was inevitably noisy and uncomfortable for me, I wish they waited after the check out hour -11:30- but it's only minor complaint.

The pillow can be bigger instead of that long one :)

The layout of the entire building.

Review Title: Nice facilities/kind staff (but no com. kitchen)

Positive Reviews: Very nice service. Fran checked me in, and he was the nicest! When I asked him for recommendations of what to see in the area, he went on google maps on his computer, and showed me the map of where there were, and pictures of the sites so I knew what it would be like. And he wrote them down for me, which was very helpful :) I think I went down 4 or 5 times to ask different things - everytime, he was super nice :) The rooms/beds were good quality. Each bed had a privacy curtain, 2 sockets, reading light, a small ledge for your phone/tissues/key card etc., and a metal file holder attached to the wall for laptop/diary/wallet etc. You get a lock for your luggage cage below the beds (which is where you'll find your blanckets/pillow etc.). The kitchen/common area was nice and large - a lot of people were spread out on the tables doing work, eating, or just chilling. There's a small lobby area by reception that you can hang out in as well.

Review Title: Excellent location and staff, but could use some improvements
Negative Reviews:
I was allocated a lower bunk, which turned out to be a uniquely uncomfortable experience, because the bottom of the top bunk was too low. I couldn't sit up without banging my head against the top bunk. And I'm not even unusually tall (just 1.6 meters), so taller individuals may find this an even bigger problem. So in theory, while I had a private space for reading or using the computer in bed, having to crouch all the time made it too difficult to actually do these things.

There are no hooks in the room to allow you to hang your clothes. I would have preferred to let my clothes dry in the air rather than fold them in the locker, given the hot weather in Madrid and how sweat-drenched you can become.

A chair (or stool) or two also would have made the room more comfortable, so you don't have to sit on the floor or on the bed in your outside clothes if you don't want to. Anyway, the problem with the lower bunk that I mention above makes sitting in your bed impossible.

The common room was uncomfortably warm. I'm not sure if it was because the air-conditioning was switched off or just not working. Between the very cramped lower bunk and the very hot common room, I didn't have a great time trying to read or use my computer at the hostel.
Positive Reviews: The hostel has an excellent location along one of the main roads in Madrid, the Gran Via, with many places to eat and drink. Staff are very helpful and polite. The room was fairly clean and quiet. There are lockers for putting away your luggage, and the hostel also gives you a lock and key to secure your locker. The beds have privacy curtains, a night lamp, and a socket for charging your electronic devices.

No place to fill up water bottles either. Showers really need an upgrade, water all over the floors and quite dirty.
Positive Reviews: Really good location and convenient to get around. Decent enough beds and pillows. Really liked the storage space provided as it was big and fit our large bags.

Review Title: Acceptable for the price yet it could be better
Negative Reviews:
The room was tiny, it didn't even have a desk. I had no space besides my bed to organize my stuff. 
I suffer from rhinitis, and the dust made it worse to the point it blocked my nose for days, with bloody dried mucus inside. I only spent a night there but suffered its effects for the next few days, so imagine how bad it was. I couldn't sleep a wink that night.
The bunk beds were not very comfortable, especially the upper one where I slept. I hurt my feet every time I went up, and always thought I'd fall and hurt myself while going down because the stairs are awful.
The bathrooms weren't great either. They have separate rooms for showers and toilet seats, and two of the showers weren't working well - the water was just boiling, and I couldn't choose a better temperature. When I arrived - around 5PM - everything was clean, but when I went there at night, the sink was a mess. Because of the guests, ofc, overall it looked clean.
There's only one hair dryer in each WC, and it's very weak, so it's almost useless.
Positive Reviews: I reserved this hostel because it seemed reasonable and cheap for a night. The location is excellent and they offer breakfast for 6‚Ç¨. All beds have lights and curtains and a big shelf with a lock to save our luggage, which is great. Breakfast is simple but it feeds and is not expensive. The employees were friendly and the hostel has a good presentation.
Room Type: Single Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room

The bed was very uncomfortable. The air conditioning is extremely noisy and as it is centrally controlled, there's nothing you can do to make yourself comfortable.

Negative Reviews: The room was tiny, the ac was audible all the time, but while the whole place was very cold, the room was stuffy and warm. At night it was pretty noisy (other guests). The room was not very clean (left behind Trash from prior guests).
Positive Reviews: The staff was very nice, the beds good and the Location is very central.

Negative Reviews:
the check in tooks 50 minutes
the room was very cold

Review Title: Enjoyable but lacking in facilities & some activities would have been nice. R
Negative Reviews: There was no cold water fountain to fill up my water bottle/no fridge to keep food items. No activities were organised from the hostel which was a shame because the point in staying in a hostel alone is to meet people! No music playing in the communal area upstairs/no general atmosphere in that room.
Positive Reviews: The location and staff were amazing! They were kind and courteous. The hostel was very clean and the beds were comfortable.

Negative Reviews: The room‚Äôs floor wasn‚Äôt clean and it was too cold in the halls and common areas of the hostel, because of the strong a/c. The duvet cover was too warm instead, and it was impossible to seep with that without sweating. During the night, that part of the city was too noisy and it was really hard to fall asleep. Also, i suggest to put some more furniture in the toilet so we can put our stuff for the shower.
Positive Reviews: The location is really nice and the position is central. The hostel is on the Gran Via, close to all the main attractions. Hostel was cozy and quiet.

Negative Reviews:
I stayed in a 8 room dorm. The bunk was very small, I could not sit up in the bottom bunk and kept bumping my head. It was also not very long maybe 180cm max. The room was freezing cold one night and super hot the next. 
The bathroom was not very clean at points in the day and most annoying of all the showers only stay on for about 5-10 seconds so you have to click it every 10 seconds. Really bad common room set up, basically a dark room with a bunch of tables squished together so you cant do much.
Positive Reviews: comfortable mattress and dorms have curtains. location is on busy Main Street full of high end of shops.
Room Type: Single Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room

Review Title: on overall, good experience and localization
Negative Reviews: i was in a dorm and the bunk bed was not comfortable as i could not even sit in the bed, the shared floor is agreeable in order to work but not to relax or interact with other people
Positive Reviews: localization was great, i could do almost everything waljing, the team was really nice and everything was clean thanks to the lovely cleaning ladies
Room Type: Single Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room

Negative Reviews:
I paid for a private room with a bathroom and the room situation was bizarre. There's absolutely no space for a bathroom. The shower is so small you can barely move and you have to press the water button every ten seconds. The toilet is in a small cubicle next to your bed, so when you use the toilet, the smell can take over the entire room.

When you shower, the water immediately wets the whole floor and there's maybe 1 meter of space separating your bed from the shower. I got my entire suitcase wet just by using my "private" shower. After that, I used the communal bathrooms, but having paid a premium for my own bathroom, this wasn't ideal.

Also, Madrid was in a heat wave when I visited. There was no air conditioner. I was dying of sweat. I literally had to sleep with no blankets on just to survive the heat and it was the most miserable sleep I've had in months. Why advertise this as a 2-star hotel when there's no air conditioner at all? I've been to roach motels with air conditioners.

A lot of private room hostels are run like hotels. This one is unfortunately not that. It's a hostel experience, with near hotel prices.
Positive Reviews: The location was fantastic in the heart of Madrid on Gran Via, in the center of everything. Staff was very friendly and helpful as well, and the hostel was thoroughly clean.

Review Title: It was time passing I just stayed a night I could not think of staying there ever again unless they
Negative Reviews: Beds should be 3 or 4 in each room .
Positive Reviews: Actually every room should have only 3 beds there were 8 or 10 beds of different persons. Beds should not be upside down. Only strait beds 3 or 4 were enough. People who live there do not try to live clean.

Negative Reviews: it was not comfortable. they didn‚Äôt manage my request (that wasn‚Äôt difficult)
Positive Reviews: Location was great

Negative Reviews: Noise non stop in the night
Positive Reviews: Very noisy, not possible to sleep and rest in the night. People are coming in and out of the room all the night long. Then in the morning the cleaning lady is cleaning WC and simply smashing the toilet cover that you can hear that noise even in the room
Room Type: Single Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room

Negative Reviews: Bathrooms very dirty, and in the shared room people does not respect the rules. Very difficult to rest
Positive Reviews: Staff

Negative Reviews: The policies are not clear, I asked a room for a child (17 years old) and I pay it in advance. I arrived at 12 am and they told me that a child pay as an adult but can't be in shared room, it means that they are adults when they want. The app allow the booking but I must pay other ultra expensive hotel for him and my mom, but they did the check in for all of us. I thought that I had read bad but this night the hostel receive 2 same cases (children about 17 years old) and they were not welcome here at 1 am, poor guys.
Positive Reviews: The zone, the location.

Negative Reviews:
1. Bathroom situation is all around bad there. 
- There is one large bathroom for each gender (with about 6 toilets and showers each I believe, and one small bathroom (with 2 of each). That's it, for all the guests. And with that ratio... It should be no surprise that things got really nasty, really quickly. 
- The showers had literally no place to put things except one hanger (which would get some water spray, so you'd want to cover your stuff with your towel) inside, and a tiny spot for soap. 
- And worst of all... The showers had a water timer (which is fine! Environmentally friendly and reasonable at a hostel) - but, it was set for 5-6 seconds. Literally, I counted. So every 5 seconds, you have to push it down, or your water would cut off. Now I'm a quick shower-er (especially at hostels)... But this is not normal. 
2. The beds/bedrooms are quite minimal & small even in comparison to other hostels, with no hangers whatsoever and only a teen shelf for example.
Positive Reviews:
Pros: 
- If you're using this as a one-night stop-over, it's a great location. Location is 20min walk to Atoche (train station) & 5 mins walk to where the rapid bus to the airport stops. And if you want to go out in the Gran Via area, sure it's the right spot. 
- The workers are good. Front desk staff are efficient and nice. When I came, my bed and bedsheets had some hairs on them - and the front desk had a cleaning lady come by immediately to replace them.

Negative Reviews: bathrooms and rooms were dirty
Positive Reviews: location

Negative Reviews:
If you are taller then 1.80 the bed might be short for you a bit.
There is no kitchen
So I just arrived back to Europe from my 3 months travel around Latinam√©rica and i arrived to the hostel around 1o 'clock, i get in the hostel and the receptionist telling me the check in is at 3 pm on a way like i should know this and why i am here.... So after i could not sleep on my 9 hours of night flight i asked this guy can i drop my heavy bags here because IF I DONT ASK HIM HE WOULD NOT OFFER IT. It was very sad to arrive back to this to Europe I was volunteering as a receptionist in other countries and i was always happy and kind with the guests. I hope he only had a bad day and in the rest of the days he is more happy and helpful. The rest of the staff were cool.
Some of the showers dont work.
Positive Reviews: Good location, nice beds, very modern.

Negative Reviews: It was a 2 bed dorm but the staff allowed 2 people to stay in 1 bed. They were very disrespectful,  shouting during the early hours and left the door open all night. I dont think it was fair the staff allowed 3 people to stay in the room when it was for 2. I've been travelling for 2 months and this is the most expensive hostel I've stayed in and not good value for money
Positive Reviews: Beds comfy and big

Negative Reviews: could not check in early. my room had the trash from the prior person in it.
Positive Reviews: location

Negative Reviews: The staff was so rude
Room Type: Single Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room

Negative Reviews: Noisy staff. Do they not realise that they talk so loud till midnight?
Positive Reviews: Beds were clean.

Negative Reviews: Too much street noise and small room crowded with beds.
Positive Reviews: Great staff and clean.

Negative Reviews:
1) All Security drawers under the bed do not lock
The drawers just slide out weather under padlock or not
2) fellow sleepers slamming door all day and night
3) All showers & faucets turn off automatically every 5 seconds! So you have to reset button every 5 seconds while showering!
Positive Reviews: Location

Review Title: Clean and comfortable hotel-like hostel in the heart of Madrid
Negative Reviews: Not the most friendly or welcoming staff or environment, it is a very hotel like hostel - there are some common areas to sit in but it didn't feel very social. No access to any kitchen like facilities, I think I had to fill up my drink bottle in the bathrooms (still drinkable water though).
Positive Reviews: Perfect location on a main road near heaps of shops, restaurants and bar districts, as well as walkable to museums and other attractions. The hostel is less than 5 minutes walk to the metro station as well if you prefer the metro. Super comfortable bed and bedding with good curtains around the bed, a towel provided for free, and very large lockers that can fit a large suitcase inside (most lockers don't fit my size of suitcase!). Luggage storage is 2 euros per person per day. Very clean.

Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: Excellent facility , excellent kind and helpful staff, Common room and kitchen superb. Great location
Friendliness of the Staff .
Room Type: Single Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room

Negative Reviews:
- the ac was really cold but we had big blankets so it was alright 
- only two bathrooms for a lot of rooms
- the bathroom was really disgusting
Positive Reviews:

- curtains on the beds

Negative Reviews: no kitchen
Positive Reviews: great big hostel, private beds, great aircon!
Room Type: Single Bed in 8-Bed Female Dormitory Room

Negative Reviews: There was no shampoo or conditioner neither shower rags by the towels!!! Only huge towels.
Positive Reviews: The location and the view through the windows.

Negative Reviews: air con could be better.
Positive Reviews: ergonomics and value for money. superb location

Negative Reviews: nothing
Positive Reviews: the location

Negative Reviews: there is nothing I didn‚Äôt like
Positive Reviews: really nice location and very clean

Negative Reviews: I stayed at other hostels in Spain that did a group dinner/ offered more scope for interaction between travellers.  I felt this hostel could do with these things to foster a social culture
Positive Reviews: Location, friendly staff on reception.

Review Title: good stay at an amazing location

Positive Reviews: location is perfect

Negative Reviews: Since the lockers are not stable, you can move the boxes and it was unsafe and you could access your stuff even though it is locked. Positive Reviews: We really liked the location, the staff wifi, and the common bathrooms as we were able to use it at the same time.

close to everything 
great breakfast

Positive Reviews: Great location and a good price. The staff were friendly as well.
